description.compact: Class to access a lists resources from the create send API.

docblock.description: This class includes functions to create lists and custom fields, along with accessing the subscribers of a specific list

description.compact: The base route of the lists resource.

param.description: The list id to access (Ignored for create requests)
Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

description.compact: Change the list id used for calls after construction
Creates a new list based on the provided details.

docblock.description: Both the UnsubscribePage and the ConfirmationSuccessPage parameters are optional

param.description: The client to create the campaign for
The list details to use during creation.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'Title' => string The list title 'UnsubscribePage' => string The page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribe 'ConfirmedOptIn' => boolean Whether this list requires confirmation of subscription 'ConfirmationSuccessPage' => string The page to redirect subscribers to when they confirm their subscription 'UnsubscribeSetting' => string Unsubscribe setting must be CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. See the documentation for details: http://www.campaignmonitor.com/api/lists/#creating_a_list )

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created list

description.compact: Updates the details of an existing list Both the UnsubscribePage and the ConfirmationSuccessPage parameters are optional

param.description: The client to create the campaign for
The list details to use during creation.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'Title' => string The list title 'UnsubscribePage' => string The page to redirect subscribers to when they unsubscribe 'ConfirmedOptIn' => boolean Whether this list requires confirmation of subscription 'ConfirmationSuccessPage' => string The page to redirect subscribers to when they confirm their subscription 'UnsubscribeSetting' => string Unsubscribe setting must be CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. See the documentation for details: http://www.campaignmonitor.com/api/lists/#updating_a_list 'AddUnsubscribesToSuppList' => boolean When UnsubscribeSetting is CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS, whether unsubscribes from this list should be added to the suppression list. 'ScrubActiveWithSuppList' => boolean When UnsubscribeSetting is CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS, whether active subscribers should be scrubbed against the suppression list. )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Creates a new custom field for the current list

param.description: The details of the new custom field.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'FieldName' => string The name of the new custom field 'DataType' => string The data type of the new custom field This should be one of CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_TEXT CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_NUMBER CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_MULTI_SELECTONE CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_MULTI_SELECTMANY CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_DATE CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_COUNTRY CS_REST_CUSTOM_FIELD_TYPE_USSTATE 'Options' => array<string> Valid options for either Multi-Optioned field data type. 'VisibleInPreferenceCenter' => boolean representing whether or not the field should be visible in the subscriber preference center. )

return.description: A successful response will be the

docblock.return: personalisation tag of the newly created custom field

description.compact: Updates a custom field for the current list

param.description: The personalisation tag of the field to update
The details of the new custom field.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'FieldName' => string The new name for the field 'VisibleInPreferenceCenter' => boolean representing whether or not the field should be visible in the subscriber preference center. )

return.description: A successful response will be the

docblock.return: personalisation tag of the updated custom field

description.compact: Updates the optios for the given multi-optioned custom field

param.description: The personalisation tag of the field to update
The set of options to add to the custom field
Whether to remove any existing options not contained in $new_options

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Deletes an existing list from the system

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Deletes an existing custom field from the system

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Gets a list of all custom fields defined for the current list

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets a list of all segments defined for the current list

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all active subscribers added since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all unconfirmed subscribers added since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all bounced subscribers who have bounced out since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all unsubscribed subscribers who have unsubscribed since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all subscribers who have been deleted since the given date

param.description: The date to start getting subscribers from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'NAME', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets the basic details of the current list

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ListID' => The id of the list 'Title' => The title of the list 'UnsubscribePage' => The page which subscribers are redirected to upon unsubscribing 'ConfirmedOptIn' => Whether the list is Double-Opt In 'ConfirmationSuccessPage' => The page which subscribers are redirected to upon confirming their subscription 'UnsubscribeSetting' => The unsubscribe setting for the list. Will be either CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ALL_CLIENT_LISTS or CS_REST_LIST_UNSUBSCRIBE_SETTING_ONLY_THIS_LIST. }

description.compact: Gets statistics for list subscriptions, deletions, bounces and unsubscriptions

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets the webhooks which are currently subcribed to event on this list

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Creates a new webhook based on the provided details

param.description: The details of the new webhook

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'Events' => array<string> The events to subscribe to. Valid events are CS_REST_LIST_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIBE, CS_REST_LIST_WEBHOOK_DEACTIVATE, CS_REST_LIST_WEBHOOK_UPDATE 'Url' => string The url of the page to POST the webhook events to 'PayloadFormat' => The format to use when POSTing webhook event data, either CS_REST_WEBHOOK_FORMAT_JSON or CS_REST_WEBHOOK_FORMAT_XML (xml or json) )

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created webhook

description.compact: Sends test events for the given webhook id

param.description: The id of the webhook to test

return.description: A successful response will be empty.

description.compact: Deletes an existing webhook from the system

param.description: The id of the webhook to delete

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Activates an existing deactivated webhook

param.description: The id of the webhook to activate

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Deactivates an existing activated webhook

param.description: The id of the webhook to deactivate

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: The protocol to use while accessing the api
The base route of the create send api.
The serialiser to use for serialisation and deserialisation of API request and response data
The transport to use to send API requests

var.description: or CS_REST_SocketTransport or your own custom transport.

description.compact: The logger to use for debugging of all API requests
The default options to use for each API request.

docblock.description:
These can be overridden by passing in an array as the call_options argument to a single api request. Valid options are:
deserialise boolean: Set this to false if you want to get the raw response. This can be useful if your passing json directly to javascript.
While there are clearly other options there is no need to change them.

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')
Note that this method will continue to work in the deprecated case when $auth_details is passed in as a string containing an API key.

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

comment.value: If $auth_details is a string, assume it is an API key

description.compact: Refresh the current OAuth token using the current refresh token.

return.description: True if the wrapper is using SSL.

description.compact: Internal method to make a general API request based on the provided options
